title: Sentinel
blurb: The Sentinel system supplies sensor and satellite data and near-real-time feeds for natural hazards such as bushfire fire and floods.

headerConfig.title: Applying geoscience to Australia's most important challenges

maps.title: Sentinel Hotspots
maps.previewDescription: Sentinel hotspots is a national bushfire monitoring system that provides timely information about hotspots to emergency service managers across Australia. The mapping system allows users to identify fire locations with a potential risk to communities and property.

maps.title: Sentinel Floods
maps.previewDescription: Sentinel floods provides satellite data, reports and feeds for flood risk mapping.

maps.title: What is a flood?
maps.previewDescription: A simple definition of flooding is water where it is not wanted.
